snippet: In submissions of tax burdens from readers, James Ross, founder of a New York investment firm, reported paying a 102 percent rate. He is hit by taxes on high earners, but a middle-income earner could also end up with higher taxes than taxable income.
lead_paragraph: In submissions of tax burdens from readers, James Ross, founder of a New York investment firm, reported paying a 102 percent rate. He is hit by taxes on high earners, but a middle-income earner could also end up with higher taxes than taxable income.

headline.seo: How It’s Possible to Pay a 100% Tax Rate
headline.main: How It’s Possible to Pay a 100% Tax Rate
